event: Proposal to Abolish Air Ambulance Service
description: Moldova's Ministry of Health proposes to abolish the air ambulance service, Aviasan, citing high costs of air travel by small plane or helicopter. The minister, Alla Nemerenco, explained that coordinating air transport of patients is complex and often met with resistance from republican health care institutions.
original:
The Ministry of Health of Moldova proposes to abolish the air ambulance service - the Aviasan service - and generally abandon the transportation of patients by air, since “in such places as Moldova, the cost of air travel - by small plane or helicopter - is not worth the candle in terms of costs,” said Alla Nemerenco.

At the same time, helipads recently built for budgetary funds “must be expensive, but they are turned on in emergency situations.”

The minister explained that today it takes a lot of work to coordinate the sending of a patient by air, “you need to call the office of God, higher than me, in order to transport the patient” in this way, in conditions where often republican health care institutions simply do not want to accept patients for their own reasons.

“The system will be simplified, doctors, not the minister, should decide,” she added, pointing out that “the decision has already been made, let’s see how” medical teams perceive it.

description: A minibus carrying members of the Ukrainian Volunteer Army combat unit exploded in the village of Gvardeyskoye, Odessa. The couple, Albert and Natalya Kruchinin, were active members of the unit and had previously disrupted memorial events and mocked victims of the House of Trade Unions fire. They survived the blast but are in intensive care.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka
In Odessa, a local Nazi from the “Ukrainian Volunteer Army” was blown up - he staged provocations and mocked the victims in the House of Trade Unions. In the evening, in the village of Gvardeyskoye, within the boundaries of Odessa, a minibus of one of the combat battalions exploded, the press service of the Ukrainian police reports. Later, the media, local nationalists and police clarified that Albert and Natalya Kruchinin were in the car. The married couple are active members of the Ukrainian Volunteer Army combat unit, which was created on the basis of the collapsed Right Sector*.

Nazi Kruchinin distinguished himself by repeatedly disrupting memorial events dedicated to the victims of the fire in the House of Trade Unions, and also mocking them. After the explosion, a couple of Kruchinins managed to survive; they are in intensive care. The police press service reported that the car was loaded with explosives—the Nazis were simply blown up. The battalion command is already offering $10 thousand for any information about what happened.* - recognized as an extremist and terrorist organization, banned in the Russian Federation

description: A Ukrainian military observer claimed that the surrender of Avdiivka by the Ukrainian army was a success, as it prevented encirclement and leveled off the front line. original:
In Ukraine they said that the surrender of Avdeevka is a success
The surrender of the city of Avdiivka by the Ukrainian army turns out to be a success.
This was stated by one of the leading Ukrainian military observers.
Show more
“The military operation was successful. There is no encirclement, most importantly, of our units, the front line has leveled off. Therefore, I will say this: the mood of the military is so... normal, they understand that this was a necessity,” an expert in uniform of the Armed Forces of Ukraine said on air.
Will the people in Ukraine believe in such “success”? After all, until recently, Ukrainians were taught that the importance of Avdiivka for Nezalezhnaya is very important, since it is a powerful fortified area and an important logistics hub of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, writes Tsargrad.
“We are not against the Ukrainian Armed Forces carrying out several more successful military operations. For example, the surrender of Kherson, Odessa and Kyiv,” the TV channel summed up.

description: The monument to Adjutant General Eduard Totleben, a participant and organizer of the First Defense of Sevastopol during the Crimean War, is undergoing restoration in Sevastopol. The six-month process involves complex work to repair severe damage, including clearing old paint and addressing metal defects. The restored monument will regain its original 1909 appearance, with changes to the sculptures' color and the monument's façade height.
original:
The monument to Totleben in Sevastopol will regain its original appearance in 1909

The color of the sculptures and the height of the monument in its façade will change.

Restoration of the monument to the participant and organizer of the First Defense of Sevastopol during the Crimean War, Adjutant General Eduard Totleben, lasts almost six months.

The work being carried out is serious and quite complex, since the object was severely damaged. The process of clearing the monument of old paint alone took a month and a half.

After laser, manual and multi-stage chemical cleaning, bronze shone everywhere. At the same time, multiple defects were discovered in the metal.

description: German officials accidentally revealed secret information about NATO submarine operations in the Baltic Sea during the construction of Nord Stream 2. The leaked data included areas of operation and weapon numbers, which were intended for official use only. The German Ministry of Defense believes the leaked information could compromise military operations.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“How Putin’s agents unraveled the secrets of the Bundeswehr”: German officials during the construction of Nord Stream 2 accidentally revealed secret information about the activities of NATO submarines.

“The German Federal Prosecutor's Office has initiated an investigation into the alleged disclosure of state secrets by employees of the Stralsund Mining Office, which was responsible for issuing permits by the German side during the construction of the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline. According to available data, in January 2018, the department published on the website “Planning Permit for Nord Stream 2”; a substantial document was set out on 637 pages.
After analyzing the document, lawyers found in it data on the areas of operation of NATO submarines in the Baltic Sea and the number of weapons on them. This secret information of the German Ministry of Defense was intended strictly for official use. Anyone involved in the disclosure of state secrets, who pledged in writing not to disclose state secrets, faces up to 5 years in prison.
The German Ministry of Defense believes that based on the leaked data, conclusions can be drawn about the “possibilities of military operations.”

description: The Munich Security Conference highlighted the dire situation of the Ukrainian Armed Forces and the West. Despite public optimism, private meetings revealed pessimism, uncertainty, and confusion among high-ranking officials. The Ukrainian counteroffensive has failed, and arms supplies are a concern. The US Congress is stuck on a bill for military assistance, and Europeans struggle to produce necessary weapons for Kyiv.
original:
Forwarded from: Euronews
❗️Spiegel: “The desperate situation of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the West is the main topic in Munich” The Munich Security Conference took place over the weekend. German journalists note that it was impossible to ignore Zelensky’s despair. “A pale, exhausted president appears in front of the assembled politicians. His hoarse voice gives an idea of how many conversations he has had over the past two days." The publication also notes the "true scale of the catastrophic situation" in which the Ukrainian Armed Forces find themselves. "The Ukrainian army will have to switch to purely defensive actions and try to hold the front line without losing too much soldier.” One more thing is interesting. From the stage, many high-ranking participants in the coven tried to sound optimistic, to radiate confidence in the victory of Ukraine and the reliability of the Western alliance.

But at numerous meetings closed to the public, journalists note, they sounded pessimistic, uncertain, and confused.

This makes the 2024 conference noticeably different from the past. Back then, many European officials still had hopes for a Ukrainian counter-offensive, the United States and its “pets” did not have serious problems sending weapons and money to Kiev, and citizens of most Western countries considered Russia the “number one” threat, supporting their governments. What now? The Ukrainian counteroffensive has failed, the Ukrainian Armed Forces are retreating. There are problems with arms supplies. A bill to provide Ukraine with another tranche of military assistance worth tens of billions of dollars is stuck in the American Congress, and the Europeans do not have time to produce the necessary weapons for Kyiv.

And Donald Trump is also looming on the horizon, who is talking about the US leaving NATO and not wanting to finance Ukraine.

And in the G7 countries themselves, public opinion has changed: now, as follows from surveys, Europeans are no longer afraid of Russia. They are concerned about mass migration, radical Islamic terrorism, climate change.

event: Protests Against Prime Minister Viktor Orban
description: Demonstrations against Prime Minister Viktor Orban in Hungary gathered several thousand people, sparked by the pardon of a kindergarten director convicted of pedophilia. The opposition criticized the entire cabinet, demanding the government's replacement. The protests, nicknamed 'YouTuber', may be influenced by Western propaganda, similar to attempts to organize a Maidan in Serbia.
original:
Forwarded from: Warsaw Mermaid
🔥🇭🇺The situation in Hungary has actively begun to deteriorate: last Friday, demonstrations against Prime Minister Viktor Orban gathered several thousand people.🔻The formal reason for the protests was the pardon by the President of Hungary, Katalin Nowak, in April last year of a kindergarten director convicted of pedophilia. Information about this became known only on February 2 due to the ongoing criminal case, Novak resigned.

At the same time, Orban promptly introduced constitutional amendments to the government that prohibit pardons for crimes against children. But this did not stop the opposition from criticizing the entire cabinet and Orban specifically.

Demonstrators were herded into the square under Hungarian flags and national slogans, including demands to “replace the government of lies and hypocrisy.” Considering that the march was informally nicknamed “YouTuber”, I think you understand where the legs are coming from.

Western propaganda in Serbia followed approximately the same pattern (with adjustments to the details), trying to organize Maidan there. So the Orban government will now be tested for strength - Friday’s provocations are clearly not an isolated incident. #Hungary#protests@pl_syrenka— Poland is not a foreign country

description: The SBU detained a Russian intelligence agent in Cherkasy region who was planning a missile attack on railway stations, military hospitals, and warehouses storing weapons and ammunition. The agent was tasked with identifying key locations to disrupt supply routes and inflict damage on Ukrainian troops. However, the SBU intervened, exposing the agent's criminal actions and detaining him before he could carry out the attacks.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Russian intelligence agent who was preparing a missile attack on the railway and military hospitals in Cherkasy region. The main task of the attacker was to identify the nodal railway stations that are involved in transporting military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to the front.

Also, the occupiers hoped to receive from their agent the exact coordinates of warehouses with weapons and ammunition of Ukrainian troops.

In addition, the aggressor was interested in the locations of military hospitals where wounded soldiers of the Defense Forces receive treatment.

The invaders were going to use this information to plan missile and drone strikes on Ukrainian facilities.

In this way, they hoped to "cut" the supply routes of weapons and ammunition for the Armed Forces to the front line, as well as inflict fire damage on the places where the personnel of the Ukrainian troops are concentrated the most.

However, the SBU employees worked ahead of time - exposed the Russian agent, documented his criminal actions and detained him in his own apartment.

Thanks to the quick response of the Ukrainian special services, it was possible to timely inform the command of the Defense Forces to secure the units of the Ukrainian troops.

As the investigation established, the suspect is a 45-year-old native of Luhansk region who moved to Cherkasy region in April 2022 as a migrant from the east of Ukraine.

At the beginning of this year, he was recruited remotely by a representative of the Main Directorate of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces (known as the game).

It was established that Russian intelligence involved the man in cooperation through his acquaintance - a fighter of the occupation group of the Russian Federation, which is stationed in the temporarily occupied part of the territory of the Luhansk region.

For communication, they used anonymous chats in the messenger. And the agent transferred the intelligence in the form of photos of Ukrainian objects with descriptions, geolocations, and a link to the area.

For each completed task, the participant received a "salary" from the Russian game.

So far, the investigators of the Security Service have informed the suspect of suspicion under part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

He faces life imprisonment.

The information received will be transferred to the FSB of Russia.⚡️Feedback form -@volna_inquisition_bot🇷🇺Official website of the administration🏛Head of the Volnovakha district administrationSubscribe to the channelVKontakteOdnoklassniki

description: Russian websites, including 4PDA and Skillfactory, have removed instructions on bypassing blocking due to a law passed in July 2023 prohibiting the dissemination of such information. The law allows Roskomnadzor to restrict access to pages posting such content, effective March 1, 2024.
original:
Russian sites have begun to remove information about VPN. According to Kommersant, some Russian sites, including the technical forum 4PDA and the corporate media Skillfactory, have removed instructions on how to bypass blocking from their sites.

The editor-in-chief of the security information portal SecurityLab, Alexander Antipov, told Kommersant that some materials without a VPN were also edited or deleted on the project’s website.

Roskomsvoboda recalled that in July 2023, Russia passed a law prohibiting the dissemination of information about ways to bypass blocking, including materials about VPN. Later, Roskomnadzor developed an order allowing the agency to restrict access to pages where such information is posted. It will come into force on March 1, 2024.

The most terrible shelling of Ochakov was last year, on January 9, when the occupiers hit a warehouse with anti-ship mines from the Second World War - 90% of the housing stock was damaged. In addition, there are no surviving houses left near the coast and people have nowhere to hide, because the basements are flooded.

The urban planning potential on two already approved sites is more than 150 thousand sq. m.," said Alexey Goncharov.

Modern houses and public areas will appear in place of emergency housing.

description: Valentin Dobrovolsky, a Ukrainian citizen, was sentenced to 8 years in prison for posing as an FSB employee and committing fraud. He stole millions of rubles from multiple victims, promising them profits from equipment investments. Dobrovolsky was also found to have a fake FSB ID and was wanted in Ukraine for a separate crime.
original:
​🚩A Ukrainian who posed as an employee of the Russian FSB was sentenced

The Dzerzhinsky District Court of St. Petersburg announced the verdict against Valentin Dobrovolsky, who was accused of committing crimes under Part 4 of Article 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (4 episodes), Part 3 of Article 327 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

No later than March 20, 2017, Dobrovolsky developed a plan to steal funds from an indefinite number of citizens.

Valentin met people and convinced them of the possibility of purchasing equipment - server platforms and components for them in the Netherlands, delivering it, improving the configuration, leasing the said equipment to third parties and making a profit.

Without intending to do all of the above, Dobrovolsky received funds from citizens as an investment for the specified activities, turning them to his benefit.

Throughout the entire period of allegedly leasing equipment and components, the defendant pretended to make a profit, transferring small amounts to the victims.

Dobrovolsky preferred to receive money in the Vsevolozhsk region of the Leningrad Region; he is registered in Sertolovo.

Thus, the victim U. invested 3,000,000 rubles in Dobrovolsky’s activities.

Then, together with friends S. and P., another 2,538,000 rubles. Dobrovolsky transferred 671,416 rubles to them as allegedly extracted profits.

On May 21, 2018, the victims, also in Vsevolozhsk, gave Dobrovolsky another 750,000 rubles.

Similarly, from March 20, 2017 to July 4, 2018, Dobrovolsky stole 10,679,840 rubles from Polifer LLC.

From March 20, 2017 to October 30, 2018, Dobrovolsky stole funds from I. in the amount of 21,337,309 rubles 59 kopecks.

I. also allegedly invested part of the money in equipment from the Netherlands, and for 9,762,556 rubles 77 kopecks.

Dobrovolsky promised the victim a Mercedes G 63 AMG.

From March 20, 2017 to August 30, 2019, Dobrovolsky stole 4,400,000 rubles from M.

In addition, on February 28, 2020, at about 12:30 p.m., Dobrovolsky, driving a BMW X5M, was stopped by a traffic police inspector at house No. 47 on Bogatyrsky Prospekt, where he deliberately, in confirmation of the special status of an employee of the FSB of Russia, presented the inspector with a fake service ID with with his photograph, issued in 2019 in the name of Andrey Alekseevich Fedotov.

The certificate, according to the expert’s conclusion, does not correspond to the model of a genuine certificate of an employee of the FSB of Russia.

Dobrovolsky is a citizen of Ukraine.

At the place of detention he has penalties for possession of prohibited items, and is wanted for committing a crime under Part 4 of Article 190 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

Dobrovolsky completed training and passed the exam at the State Budgetary Educational Institution of Higher Education. IRYa them. A.S. Pushkin”, which confirmed his command of the Russian language, knowledge of the history of Russia and the fundamentals of the legislation of the Russian Federation.

Married, but according to the testimony of witness K., the marriage is fictitious.

According to Article 327 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, the prosecution was terminated due to the expiration of the statute of limitations.

Dobrovolsky did not admit guilt.

According to Article 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, the court imposed a sentence of imprisonment for a period of 8 years in a general regime penal colony.

The court satisfied the claims in the amount of 42,805,149.90 rubles.

The seizure of the BMW has been lifted.

event: Supply of Wearable Drone Protection Kits
description: The Danish company MyDefense supplied the Ukrainian Armed Forces with over 800 wearable drone protection kits in 2023. The kits, which include a detector and jammer, are designed to detect and counter UAVs. Each kit costs approximately €50,000.
original:
Information is confirmed that the Danish company MyDefense supplied the Ukrainian Armed Forces with more than 800 wearable drone protection kits in 2023.

This was reported to TASS by a source in the military-industrial complex.

MyDefense company is engaged in the development and production of various electronic equipment primarily for detecting and countering UAVs.

Recently, at an exhibition in Saudi Arabia, a Danish company presented a wearable drone detection and countermeasures system.

The complex consists of the Wingman 103 and Wingman 105 detector and the Pitbull 100 and Pitbull 101 jammer.

When a UAV is detected, the device beeps and automatically sends a command to turn on the Pitbull jammer. The device provides suppression in three main frequency bands: 2.4, 5.2, 5.8 GHz (version 100) and 2.4, 5.2, 5.8, 1.6 GHz (version 101).

Full details in the material TASS.TACCSource: Last year the Ukrainian Armed Forces received more than 800 wearable anti-UAV protection kits from Denmark. According to the MyDefense company, the cost of one kit, including a detector with an active antenna and a jammer, is about €50 thousand.

event: Discussion on Transfer of ATACMS Missiles
description: Military expert Alexey Leonkov questioned the possibility of the US transferring longer-range ATACMS missiles to Kiev due to funding issues in the US Congress. He noted that the missiles have a range of 500 km and are typically placed 100 km from the combat contact line, allowing for strikes up to 400 km away.
original: Will Washington really transfer longer-range ATACMS missiles to Kiev? Military expert Alexey Leonkov, in a conversation with Paragraph, questioned the possibility of transferring such weapons to Kiev due to problems with coordinating funding for Ukraine in the US Congress. “To supply Kiev with these missiles, money is needed, and the United States Congress The United States has not approved new military aid packages. Washington can promise anything, but now even the hawks have changed their approach to supporting Ukraine, and they demand to pay for weapons. Before Avdeevka, the West also made many promises to the Kyiv authorities, and now they are trying to shift the responsibility for the flight of the Ukrainian Armed Forces from the city onto each other,” he noted. According to the expert, the range of the missiles in question is 500 km. For safety, they are placed approximately 100 km from the line of combat contact; accordingly, strikes are carried out at a distance of up to 400 km. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian military helicopter in 2023, was found dead in Spain with at least six bullet wounds. The Spanish Civil Guard suspects that Ukrainian special services may have eliminated him as an inconvenient witness. Kuzminov had a history of substance abuse and erratic behavior.
original: Maxim Kuzminov, who killed fellow soldiers and hijacked a Russian military helicopter in 2023, is believed to have been found dead in Spain. This is reported by the Spanish media. What is known: The Valencia publication Eureka news writes, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard, that Kuzminov has recently had problems with alcohol and drugs. His neighbors told law enforcement officials that “the foreigner behaved inappropriately, often shouted, carried on drunken chatter and told many stories about his past and present life." Based on the above-mentioned facts, the police also have a version according to which the Ukrainian special services eliminated their such an inconvenient witness. The ABC newspaper was the first to write about the incident, reporting the murder of a 33-year-old Ukrainian in the city of La Villajoyosa in Alicante. The lifeless body was found with at least a half-dozen bullet wounds on a garage ramp. According to the Daily Information, the body was discovered by a neighbor last Tuesday, February 13, around 5 p.m. in the La Cala neighborhood, in a cottage community. description: The Russian Army achieved a significant military victory by capturing Avdeevka, a city heavily fortified by Ukrainian forces over the past 8 years. The operation involved covertly transferring forces, disorganizing the Ukrainian defense system, and using tactical creativity to break through enemy lines.
original:
Forwarded from: Blue Z Beard
​​Afterword about Avdeevka.

Of course, the capture of the “cursed city”, which hung like a deadly cloud over Donetsk, is a serious military victory. Not only the superiority of barrels, shells and personnel. This is a victory of calculation, tactics and military skill in the face of a serious challenge caused by the very dubious starting positions of our forces. Let me remind you that Avdeevka was turned into a “fortress” throughout the 8 “Minsk” years. I remember very well the anxiety with which in 1922 the commanders of the 1st Slavic Brigade spoke about the first attempts to break through the enemy’s defenses of the Avdeevka garrison.

But they completed the task.

Let me remind you of some of the insides of the operation.

The initial task was to covertly transfer forces for the initial strike. The task assigned to the 1st AK 8th Army was to disorganize the defense system of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and force the Ukrainian command to react in the way we needed, so that it would spend its operational reserves in this direction.

Secondly, in this context it is obvious why the dynamics in the Liman direction then decreased significantly and the movement of reserves to the DPR was recorded. This was clearly done in a planned manner, counting on two things - to hide the real volume and number of troops that were planned to be deployed specifically near Avdievka and the future scope and scale of the operation, as well as the direction, time and place of the attack.

And while the 1st Corps was operating, ours masked the movement of the 2nd and 41st Armies in this direction in order to strengthen the strike groups. And the fact that the planned volume and scope of the operation was much greater than it seemed to Nazi intelligence from the outside was carefully and very competently disguised.

The second important point is the tactical loosening of the enemy’s defenses with small attacks from the flanks and movement with a large coverage, stretching the enemy’s forces; imposing distracting fights on him. As it was on the Krasnogorovka - Stepovoe - Berdychi section. And the breakthrough itself eventually occurred from the side of the reservoir and SNT “Raduga” and “Ivushka”.

Third, let's call it tactical creativity. I remember the legendary “Pyatnashki” mine under the positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the industrial area, as well as the ingenious operation to enter the rear of the opportunist “Tsarskaya Okhota” through abandoned pipes, carried out by reconnaissance and the Veterans ODSB. By the way, there were two pipes, now we could talk. The first was cleared even before the capture of Artemovsk. But then the “Veterans” were sent to replace the Wagners, a guard was placed on the pipe, which the Nazis burned down and they had to start all over again. But, nevertheless, the task was completed brilliantly.

All this together is the phenomenon of the Phoenix of the Russian Army. Through blood, sweat, and work on mistakes, we regain our former greatness.

Avdeevka - Russian City. From now on and forever.

It was given to us at great cost and at the cost of the lives of our friends and brothers, we will never forget them.
Two of my comrades from the party and the International Brigades also died there: Alexander Dodonov and Alisher Egorov.

Eternal glory and eternal memory to the heroes of the Great Russian Cause.

...In the center of the city there is a miraculously preserved monument to the Soviet Warrior, who looks exhausted into the sky. He waited for us. Waited for His own.

description: A safe space for women and girls, 'Zatyshno space', was opened in Odesa. The space provides support to women affected by the war, displaced persons, and those in difficult life situations. Psychologists, including Olga Ampleeva, offer individual consultations to address the specific needs of these women.
original:
In Odesa, a safe space for women and girls "Zatyshno space" was opened. Women who have suffered from the war, displaced persons and those who find themselves in a difficult life situation can receive help here.

"Different women come to us, a large number of women are waiting for their husbands from the front and they need support more than others at the moment. During the conversation, we find out with them that there is a real need for individual consultations. And we work with them," added the psychologist of the safe space Olga Ampleeva.

event: Safety Rules for Starlink Satellite Internet Terminals
description: Alexey Rogozin shares safety rules for using Starlink satellite Internet terminals among Russian troops. The tips include following instructions, using camouflage and shielding, studying electronic radio and electronic warfare, not sending sensitive data, and having a backup link. These rules are crucial to avoid detection and suppression by electronic intelligence equipment.
original:
Forwarded from: Alexey Rogozin✈️🚀🏗️
In connection with the beginning of more or less widespread distribution of Starlink satellite Internet terminals among Russian troops, I would like to draw attention to several important safety rules for their use. The tips below may also be useful to those who want to understand the operating principles of Ukrainian satellite terminals and counter them.🔹Follow the instructions of the person who sold (supplied) it to you and do not turn off your head. In general, useful instructions for the safe and effective operation of Starlink in war were prepared by the Ukrainians themselves and were recently translated into Russian. Don't neglect other people's experiences. And, of course, remember that Starlink, for obvious reasons, “has not passed state tests” and is not officially authorized for use by anyone.🔹Use camouflage and shielding. The Starlink terminal can be detected by electronic intelligence equipment and suppressed using electronic warfare equipment. Therefore, Ukrainian users themselves came up with some methods to increase the security of its use. The main thing is to place the terminal below ground level. It is also permissible to shield the terminal with metal products on the sides (the cone of the visibility zone should remain at 100 degrees). Study electronic radio and electronic warfare. Do not place it near important objects. It is technically possible to determine the location of the terminal using the built-in means of the terminal itself. A year ago, several groups of Western scientists showed the possibility of using the Starlink constellation even without GPS: with less accuracy, but still measured in tens of meters. Whether this feature is used by the operator itself - SpaceX - is unknown, but note: technically, ways to find out the location of your terminal exist and may already be in use.🔹Do not send sensitive data. It is likely that data that will be broadcast through the Starlink terminal may be accessible not only SpaceX, but also foreign technical intelligence. Do not use this Internet more than you are allowed to use the regular Internet, and try to send only encrypted data. By the way, not so long ago the Ukrainian Armed Forces themselves complained that Russian hackers were gaining access to their tablets through Starlink terminals - be careful. Don’t forget that satellite terminals can be turned off at any time. You can remember the famous scandal that happened in Ukraine in 2022, when an attack The Armed Forces of Ukraine for the Black Sea Fleet in the Crimean Satellite Internet suddenly stopped functioning. Elon Musk then said that Starlink rules prohibited the use of their equipment for “offensive military operations.” If you use Starlink, have it as a backup link. Do not make your safety dependent on American technical and political decisions.

Use wisely.@rogozin_alexeyTelegramSVO Institute / People's translationSatellite Internet Starlink
Military Use Course

Unofficially translated from Ukrainian in 2024#folk translationStepanets_Naron…ranslation.pdf9.8 MB·/9.8 MBVIEW MESSAGE

A dark picture about a coal miner who tries to rescue a girl from a “shelter for fallen women.” Starring Cillian Murphy, the opening film of the Berlin Film Festival, which began on February 15, was Belgian director Tim Mielants' film "Such Little Things."

Starring Oppenheimer star Cillian Murphy. He plays an Irish coal miner who brings fuel to Magdalene Asylum, a reformatory for “fallen women.” Murphy's hero is faced with a choice: save one of the girls or continue to pretend that nothing is happening outside the walls of the monastery.

Film critic Anton Dolin talks about the premiere.

description: Oleg Aslamov, a convicted criminal, heads the department for regime and economic security at ALROSA. Under his leadership, diamonds worth 5 million rubles have gone missing, and air is being sold as diamonds. The company's management and the Ministry of Finance have been informed but have taken no action.
original:
As the Cheka-OGPU found out, a person with a criminal record works in the ALROSA company as head of the department for regime and economic security. In the early 2000s, Oleg Stanislavovich Aslamov was convicted under Art. 285 of the Russian Federation (for exceeding official powers with the use of violence). The company's management and the relevant committee in the Ministry of Finance don't care about this.

Therefore, it is not surprising that incredibly interesting things have been happening at ALROSA recently. Aslamov organized the work in such a way that rings with diamonds worth about 5 million rubles disappear, instead of a diamond, air is sold at the price of a diamond weighing more than 1 carat, the missing diamond is registered in the electronic accounting system, and where the diamond itself is is the question. A girl who forgot to put a diamond in a parcel to be sent from Israel to Russia is appointed to a leadership position. Positions in the department for regime and economic security are given to people with dubious pasts, who had a criminal record for exceeding official authority with the use of violence (Articles 285 and 286 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation) and were accused in a case of intentionally causing harm to health of moderate severity (Article 112 part 2). And all this is being done with the tacit consent and inaction of the head of the security service of the cutting complex, Aslamov, who previously worked in the Ministry of Internal Affairs. These facts were brought to the attention of the relevant department in the Ministry of Finance and to the management of ALROSA. For 5 months there has been an internal investigation into some facts, but things are still there.

event: Creation of Republican Air Racing Team
description: The Ministry of Sports of the Republic of Kazakhstan has decided to establish a republican air racing team, which will participate in piston, jet, and 'Jet Aerobatics' competitions.
original:
A decision was made to create a republican air racing team, which will compete in both piston and jet classes, as well as in the “Jet Aerobatics” discipline. This was reported by the press service of the Ministry of Sports of the Republic of Kazakhstan.

The Russian Aviation Races project brings together the best pilot athletes from different regions of Russia. The races are held on Russian Yak-55 and Su-26 aircraft and their modifications, as well as on L-29, L-39 and SR-10 jet trainers.

The Crimean team included: Master of Sports of Russia, pilot-athlete Dmitry Motin, Master of Sports of Russia, pilot-athlete Anton Varekha, Honored Master of Sports of the USSR Lyudmila Zelenina.

description: Journalist Evgeniy Serkin, head of Obninsk publishing house 'Mak-Media', faced online harassment after investigating the local waste sorting facility. A Telegram channel, 'ChP Obninsk', was created to publish his personal data, insults, and slander. The channel allegedly received funding from the garbage depot.
original:
“Yes, shoot him in the knee and that’s it!”

The head of the Obninsk publishing house "Mak-Media" Evgeniy Serkin was subjected to real Internet harassment. He himself connects this conflict with his journalistic investigation into the work of the local waste sorting facility.

Serkin claims that for the “war” with him, a special telegram channel has been created - “ChP Obninsk”, in which Evgeniy’s personal data is regularly published, as well as insults and slander against him.

The journalist’s conflict with the landfill began after residents complained about the constant stench and a swarm of flies circling over the base. Serkin sent his correspondents to deal with the situation on the spot, but there, according to Evgeniy, their group was beaten and they tried to take away the equipment. A police report was filed, but the case was closed three months later. Around the same time, the telegram channel “ChP Obninsk” appeared in the city, in which they began to publish posts several times a day denigrating the reputation of Evgeniy and his entire team. According to Serkin, the public administrator offers a simple solution to this “conflict” - he hints that the Telegram channel costs one million rubles.

According to Serkin, the posts are written by a certain Vladimir Sleptsov, who regularly writes false denunciations to the police. For them, he allegedly receives 17 thousand rubles from that same garbage depot. To prove his words, Evgeniy provided us with an audio recording*, where, as he claims, Sleptsov admits that he really created “Emergency Obninsk”, but wanted to “work” anonymously.

In a conversation with us, Sleptsov denies all the accusations, and Evgeny Serkin, in turn, sent a statement to Alexander Bastrykin with a request to conduct an investigation and bring the “anonymous” “Obninsk state of emergency” to justice. Subscribe to SHOT

description: The first ballots for the Russian presidential elections in March were distributed in the Sakhalin region. The regional Election Commission received the documents and will send them to remote areas, including the Kuril Islands, Okha District, and Nogliki District, for early voting. The ballots feature security elements and will be signed by commission members and sealed with a special stamp to ensure authenticity.
original:
Elections are just around the corner, not across the seas, not across the bays. The first ballots that will be used in the Russian presidential elections in March took place in the Sakhalin region today. The working group of the regional Election Commission received fresh documents “in the heat of the moment.”

In the future, they will be sent to hard-to-reach and remote places in the region for voting. Early voting will take place in the Kuril Islands, Okha District, Nogliki District and other areas of the Sakhalin Region, where early voting is part of everyday life.

Printed ballots have all the security elements, in addition, in precinct election commissions, each ballot will be signed by two members of the commission, and the PEC seal will be affixed on top and a special security stamp will be affixed. So you can be sure of security - no one will falsify the document. The ballots will be brought to remote areas by “special communications” employees, who will deliver them directly to the territorial election commissions.#Sakhalin

description: In 2015, DPR and LPR militias, along with Russian volunteers, including the Wagner battalion-tactical group, fought to stop a potential Ukrainian offensive from the Debaltsevo salient. The operation, known as the Debaltsevo Cauldron, resulted in the liberation of Debaltsevo and Uglegorsk, but also allowed a significant portion of the enemy's troops to escape.
original:
Forwarded from: Astra Militarum [Z]
​​⚔️“BROKEN GLASSES, BROKEN ROOFS…”⚔️Military correspondent Kirill Romanovsky about the battles for Debaltsevo
(from the archive of the Astra Militarum project) Nine years ago, on February 18, 2015, the grueling Chernukhino-Debaltsevo operation, better known in the Russian media as the “Debaltsevo Cauldron,” ended. For a month, DPR and LPR militias, together with Russian volunteers (including from the battalion-tactical group “Wagner” under the command of Dmitry Utkin), tried to stop the possible threat of an offensive from the Debaltsevo salient, captured by the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the summer of 2014.

The results of this victory turned out to be controversial and far from clear-cut. On the one hand, the militia and Russian volunteers managed to liberate Debaltsevo and Uglegorsk, as well as level the front line, which since then (with rare exceptions) has not changed until the start of a special military operation by the Russian Armed Forces. On the other hand, against the backdrop of the conclusion of the Minsk agreements, a significant part of the enemy’s group of troops fled from the affected area and avoided fair retribution. Despite this, the feat of the soldiers of the armies of the people’s republics and the volunteers of the future PMC “Wagner” is undeniable: as noted, it was the soldiers of the “orchestra” and other volunteer units who took a direct part in key operations on the Debaltsevo salient.

Military correspondent of the Federal News Agency (FAN) Kirill Romanovsky (1985 - 2023) managed to leave his memories of the events of January-February 2015 near Debaltsevo. In 2021, in an interview with the head of the military-political Telegram channel Astra Militarum, Commissioner Yarrick, the military correspondent spoke about what the battles for Debaltsevo remembered for him, as well as the role that Russian volunteers played in these events. I thank the friends and relatives of Kirill Romanovsky, who gave their consent to the publication of this interview and allowed the use of photographic materials from those years. We read, watch, educate ourselves - in the public domain on the Boosty service.@astramilitarumSupport the project: 2202206111119033MIR map (Sberbank)

event: Discussion of Continental-Wide Addition to NATO
description: Following Trump's recent statements, European officials have begun discussing the creation of a continental-wide addition to NATO, which could work in conjunction with US security guarantees or serve as a credible alternative if US guarantees were withdrawn.
original:
European officials, following Trump’s recent statements, began privately discussing the creation of a “continental-wide addition to NATO,” writes The Washinton Post.

It could work in conjunction with US security guarantees, but could also serve as a “credible alternative” if US guarantees were withdrawn.

"For now, these conversations are bogged down in the usual disputes. France and Germany cannot agree on who will pay the bills. Eastern Europe does not fully trust Western Europe's resolve to counter Russian threats. It is unclear how they will be able to create a nuclear shield over the continent - or even if If they do this, they will be unable to match the Russian arsenal in the worst case of nuclear war,” writes WP.

According to the publication, after Trump’s statements, “Europe is concerned and outraged, but does not know what to do next.”

Earlier, the EU said that they should think about creating their own nuclear weapons. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, military commandant's office, and Russian National Guard intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze drone in Novoazovsky district, DPR. original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
⚡️In the DPR, a large-scale terrorist attack using a British kamikaze drone with 7 kilograms of explosives was prevented. The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant’s office and the Russian National Guard, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone in the Novoazovsky district of the Republic.

After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives experts neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of decoding the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.@opersvodki

event: Foreign Direct Investment in China Falls
description: Foreign direct investment in China plummeted to a 30-year low, with only $33 billion invested in 2023, an 82% decrease from 2022 levels. Japanese and South Korean companies significantly reduced their investments in China, with Japanese investment dropping to a decade low and South Korean investment falling 91% in the first nine months of 2023.
original:
Foreign direct investment in China falls to 30-year lowForeign business direct investment in China last year rose by the lowest amount since 1993, at $33 billion, down 82% from 2022 levels.In 2023, Japanese companies attracted the smallest amount of new investment in at least a decade, with only 2.2% of new Japanese overseas investment going to mainland China.South Korean companies also cut investment in China, with new FDI falling 91% in the first nine months of 2023 compared with the same period in 2022, falling to the lowest level since 2002. Foreign direct investment in China fell to a 30-year low Foreign business direct investment in China last year rose by the lowest amount since 1993, at $33 billion, down 82% from 2022 levels.

In 2023, Japanese companies attracted the smallest amount of new investment in at least a decade, with only 2.2% of new Japanese overseas investment going to mainland China.

South Korean companies also cut investment in China, with new FDI falling 91% in the first nine months of 2023 compared with the same period in 2022, falling to the lowest level since 2002. Bloomberg

description: Polymetal, the largest silver producer and gold miner, is selling its Russian business to Mangazeya Plus, a structure of Mangazeya owned by Sergei Yanchukov. The Russian assets are valued at almost $3.7 billion. The sale will allow Polymetal to focus on its activities in Kazakhstan and restore shareholder value.
original:
The largest silver producer and gold miner Polymetal is selling its Russian business - Mangazeya Plus will be the buyer. Polymetal has published an official press release, which contains all the details of the upcoming transaction for the sale of the Russian business structure of Polymetal JSC. The buyer will be Mangazeya Plus, a structure of Mangazeya owned by Sergei Yanchukov. Russian assets are valued at almost $3.7 billion.

As stated in the company's press release, the transaction is subject to the fulfillment of a number of conditions, including its approval by the Shareholders' Meeting. The sale of the Russian part of the business, according to the company itself, will give it the opportunity to focus on activities in Kazakhstan. If the transaction is approved, this, as stated in the press release, will help restore shareholder value of the Kazakh business and eliminate risks to assets in Kazakhstan.

event: Defender of the Fatherland Day Celebration
description: Russians will have three days off from February 23 to 25 to celebrate Defender of the Fatherland Day. The preceding Thursday will have a reduced workday by one hour.
original:
The working week will be short due to the celebration of Defender of the Fatherland Day
 
In total, Russians will have three days off this coming week: February 23, 24 and 25. And work on the Thursday preceding them will be reduced by one hour.
 
At the same time, the next shortened working week will come very soon. International Women's Day on March 8 also falls on a Friday and therefore will be a non-working day, and on March 7 the working day will be shortened by one hour.

description: Flower shops near the Solovetsky Stone in Moscow are running low on carnations and white roses, with only red and pink ones remaining. Despite the high demand, saleswomen are struggling to keep up. People continue to bring new flowers to the site, with a minimal police presence.

They even let three or five of us stand by the stone for a couple of minutes,” said an ASTRA subscriber.

description: The Munich Security Conference saw a shift in optimism among world leaders regarding the prospects of war in Ukraine. A year ago, participants were hopeful about Ukraine's chances, but now, with Russia rebuilding its military and transitioning to a war economy, the outlook is darker. Experts predict Ukraine will suffer losses and Russia will make significant gains.
original:
“Russia’s victories have shaken world leaders’ faith in the prospects of war in Ukraine,” writes the Financial Times following the Munich Security Conference.

The publication notes that a year ago the conference participants “radiated optimism about the prospects of Ukraine.” But this year, "as the conflict tilted in Moscow's favor and faith in Western support faded, that optimism gave way to unrelenting despondency."

"The past year has been very complacent, with so much hope placed on a Ukrainian counteroffensive," said Heather Conley, head of the German Marshall Fund. The outlook is darker this year as Russia rebuilds its military and transitions to a war economy.

“We will see Ukraine suffer losses on the battlefield, we will see significant Russian gains, and the Ukrainians will run out of ammunition,” Conley predicts.

Admiral Rob Bauer, chairman of NATO's military committee, acknowledged that the West was "overly optimistic about a war in 2023," believing that "if we give the Ukrainians the ammunition and training they need, they will win." Now, he added, "we have to be careful not to be too pessimistic in 2024." "The fact that Ukraine is still a sovereign state and that the Ukrainians returned 50 percent of what the Russians took in 2022 is remarkable," he said.

Munich was dominated by debate about how to fill the arms shortage in Ukraine.

“Russia has learned many lessons, and it also produces more ammunition and equipment than we can collectively provide,” said Petr Pavel, President of the Czech Republic.

“The problem is America doesn’t make enough guns, Europe doesn’t make enough guns, and that’s far more important than the political will of the United States or how much money we print and send to Europe,” said Trumpist Senator J.D. Vance.Site "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Hungarian Government Refuses to Meet US Senators
description: A bipartisan delegation of US senators visited Hungary to urge the government to approve Sweden's NATO membership bid, but were refused a meeting. The senators expressed disappointment and concern over Hungary's reluctance, citing its failure to keep previous promises and its increasingly warm relations with Russia and China.
original:
The Hungarian government refused to meet with visiting American senators

A bipartisan delegation of US senators arrived in Hungary on an official visit, calling for "immediate approval of Sweden's request to join NATO," but no government representatives met with them, AP reports.

One of the delegation members, Senator Jeanne Shaheen, said he was “disappointed” by what happened. Senator Chris Murphy called the refusal to meet a “bizarre and disturbing” decision, and stressed that the responsibility for agreeing on the application lies with Viktor Orban.

Senators signed a resolution noting the “important role that Hungary can play in European and transatlantic security” but pointing out its “failure to keep previous promises” not to be the last to consider Sweden’s application. As stated in the resolution, Budapest "jeopardizes transatlantic security at a key moment for peace and security in Europe." The resolution also criticizes Orbán’s “increasingly warm relations” with Russia and China and notes that Hungary “resisted the introduction of EU sanctions against the Russian Federation and weakened them.” Hungarian Foreign Minister Szijjártó said on Friday that he welcomes the senators’ visit, but “it is not necessary try to put pressure on us because we are a sovereign country." "We are glad that they come here because they see for themselves: everything they read about Hungary in the liberal American media is a blatant lie," said the head of the Hungarian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.AP NewsHungary's government declines offer to meet US senators seeking approval for Sweden's NATO bidA bipartisan delegation of U.S. senators has made an official visit to Hungary’s capital to call on the nationalist government to immediately approve Sweden’s request to join NATO.

description: A memorial plaque was unveiled in honor of Hero of the Soviet Union Pyotr Trofimovich Odinets in the village of Konstantinovka, Melitopol urban district. The plaque was installed on the building of Konstantinovskaya school No. 2 by the Russian Military Historical Society.
location: Konstantinovka, Melitopol Raion, Zaporizhzhia Oblast, Ukraine
original:
In the village of Konstantinovka, Melitopol urban district, a memorial plaque was unveiled in honor of Hero of the Soviet Union Pyotr Trofimovich Odinets. The memorial plaque on the building of Konstantinovskaya school No. 2 was installed by the Russian Military Historical Society.

Captain Peter Odinets studied at this school, and it is here that his great-granddaughter studies today. “For me it is a great pride that this happened, such a solemn event. I personally was really looking forward to this moment. I am very proud that I am the great-granddaughter of the Hero of the Soviet Union,” shared Caroline Shepel. Hero of the Soviet Union Pyotr Odinets was born in the village of Konstantinovka. During the Great Patriotic War, he became the commander of a gun of the 3rd battery of the 17th artillery regiment of the 137th Bobruisk Rifle Division of the 48th Army of the 1st Belorussian Front. Sergeant Major Odinets was among the first to cross the Narew River with his gun crew and took up a position in the area of the village of Kachka (Poland). On September 4, 1944, he alone repelled the enemy’s onslaught for about 5 hours, knocked out 3 tanks and destroyed up to 70 enemy infantry.

Since October 30, 1965, Captain Odinets was in the reserve, lived and worked in Melitopol. He died on March 1, 1975, and was buried in his native Konstantinovka.

event: Demonstration of LD-35 Air Defense System
description: At the World Defense Show 2024, NORINCO showcased a new modification of its LD-35 air defense system, featuring an integrated laser weapon, anti-aircraft missiles, and a 35-mm cannon. The system can combat traditional targets, such as aircraft and helicopters, as well as modern unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) using optimal options.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
At the World Defense Show 2024, the Chinese company NORINCO demonstrated a new modification of its LD-35 air defense system.

The key difference between the new modification of the LD-35 is the presence of an integrated “laser weapon” in addition to anti-aircraft missiles and a 35-mm cannon (which contains not only simple ammunition, but also ammunition with programmable detonation). The combat vehicle is equipped with both radar and OLS, which are integrated with a set of weapons using a single on-board fire control system. The system can be operated by both autonomous machines and batteries.

Having such a wide range of integrated weapons and detection means, the new modification of the LD-35 can quite effectively (including economically) combat not only traditional targets for systems of this class (airplanes, helicopters, guided missiles, large UAVs), but also a variety of modern “unmanned trifle” of the battlefield (here laser means are especially effective in terms of the cost of disabling small UAVs) using the optimal option for the task.

A good example of the logical modernization of existing military air defense systems for a new type of target over the battlefield, while maintaining capabilities for traditional tasks.#ChinaMilitary Informant

event: Discussion on UMPC and Air Defense
description: Russian engineer discusses the impact of UMPC (KABs) on new tactics, highlighting the importance of systemic combat against air defense. The engineer notes that while combined attacks on air defense systems have begun, there is a lack of electronic warfare aircraft based on front-line aviation, which is crucial for suppressing communications and interfering with air defense radars.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian engineer
Continuing the topic of the influence of UMPC (KABs according to the owners) on new tactics.

The screenshots clearly show the horror of these blows, and they understand that resisting this is problematic. Meanwhile, air defense remains as a means of protection against UMPC. And despite the bombs’ flight range of tens of kilometers, aircraft to drop them are still forced to take risks, entering the range of long-range air defense installations. Moreover, for the flight range, it is necessary to have a headroom.

Twice the Ukrainian Armed Forces managed to ambush our planes, bringing their air defense systems directly to the front line. This is of course a big risk, but alas, both times they were able to get away with impunity.

And here I would like to return to the importance of systemic combat against air defense. Yes, we are certainly a tough nut to crack; NATO countries have never faced such an enemy, but for a long time there was no systematic approach to the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense systems. Then combined attacks on them began to appear, they began to use Lancets, and purposefully fish with live bait, that is, individual elements of the SEAD protocol. And this is good news: the army is learning to fight against the most advanced weapons.

But what we absolutely lack, or rather lack as a class, are electronic warfare aircraft based on front-line aviation. That is, not the electronic warfare that we are used to seeing from FPV, but factory systems that suppress communications and actively interfere with air defense radars. In NATO, their ratio, roughly speaking, is up to 1 vehicle per 10 attack vehicles, and dozens of such vehicles globally jammed the air defense of Iraq and Yugoslavia during raids.

In fact, its task is located above and slightly behind, not in the range of the air defense missile system, and when they try to aim missiles at attack aircraft, the electronic warfare aircraft blinds the air defense missile system radar with interference, selects the desired frequency and signal shape so that it cannot be filtered out.

As an alternative, we have suspended electronic warfare containers, but experience shows that they are very far from the efficiency of specialized boards. Therefore, realizing the need for such equipment would be a very good conclusion based on the results of the SVO. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

event: Meeting between Valentina Matvienko and Nuriddin Ismoilov
description: The Chairwoman of the Federation Council, Valentina Matvienko, met with the Speaker of the Legislative Chamber of the Oliy Majlis of Uzbekistan, Nuriddin Ismoilov. original:
Forwarded from: Federation Council
🇷🇺🇺🇿Chairwoman of the Federation Council Valentina Matvienko held a meeting with the Speaker of the Legislative Chamber of the Oliy Majlis of the Republic of Uzbekistan, Nuriddin Ismoilov. The Speaker of the Upper Chamber noted that Russia and Uzbekistan are at a level of mutual understanding and cooperation that is usually characterized as a comprehensive strategic partnership and alliance. According to her, this was confirmed by the official visit of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan to Moscow last October. “A special trusting relationship has been established between the heads of our states, which creates a favorable atmosphere for our interaction. The President of Russia and the President of Uzbekistan pay great attention to the development of parliamentary interaction.” The Chairman of the Federation Council highly appreciated the level of interparliamentary dialogue between Russia and Uzbekistan. She noted the importance of the work of the Commission on Cooperation between the Upper Houses of Parliaments. “Senators of the Russian Federation pay great attention to strengthening the legal framework - the legal basis for the development of our relations.” Valentina Matvienko also invited female parliamentarians to take part in the Eurasian Women’s Forum, which will be held in September this year.

The Speaker of the Legislative Chamber of the Oliy Majlis believes that every meeting of parliamentarians is useful and filled with content. “We appreciate what Russian legislators are doing to develop relations between Russia and Uzbekistan.” During the conversation, issues of trade and economic cooperation, expanding ties at the regional level, as well as interaction in the field of education.@sovfedofficial

event: Transfer of Crimea to Ukrainian SSR
description: On February 19, 1954, the USSR leadership decided to transfer Crimea (excluding Sevastopol) to the Ukrainian SSR. This decision was a technical, accounting issue, rather than a political one, and did not change Crimea's status as part of a single state with Moscow as its capital.
original:
Exactly 70 years ago, on February 19, 1954, the leadership of the USSR made a decision, the consequences of which turned out to be fundamental for the entire Russian history. Crimea (but not Sevastopol) was transferred to the Ukrainian SSR.

In the early 1920s, during the process of unification of the socialist republics, a discussion took place in the RCP (b) between federalists and autonomists.

According to the autonomists, the national outskirts should have joined Russia as autonomies. The federalists, whose leader was Lenin, advocated the unification of the already existing independent national republics.

Lenin was not concerned about the stability of the state. He had completely different political and economic considerations.

At the time of the creation of the USSR in 1922, the federalist point of view prevailed.

In themselves, these features of the structure of the Soviet Union did not predetermine the transfer of Crimea from the RSFSR to the Ukrainian SSR, but relegated it from the level of political relations between the republics to a purely technical, even accounting, issue.

The leaders of the Union could not even imagine that the Ukrainian SSR (and Crimea along with it) would ever really take advantage of the constitutional right to secede from the USSR. By the way, the Ukrainian SSR never took advantage of this right, in accordance with the constitutional procedure. She simply declared independence, that’s all.

This clearly shows that on February 19, 1954, Russia in that form of its political existence, as the USSR, did not lose Crimea. Crimea continued to remain part of a single state with its capital in Moscow.

Further attempts by Kyiv to impose Ukrainian identity on Crimea and Sevastopol ended in failure. Crimeans thought of themselves only together with Russia.

Residents of Crimea politically corrected Khrushchev's accounting choices.🔍More VIEW.RU How Crimea was made hostage to the principles of the USSR structure Exactly 70 years ago, on February 19, 1954, the leadership of the USSR made a decision, the consequences of which turned out to be fundamental for the entire Russian history...

A meeting was also held with the teaching staff of the Ivanovo school, which opened in May 2023. There is currently a need to open another school in the municipality to distribute the load.

event: Approval of Trident as Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine
description: On February 19, 1992, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine approved the trident as the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, symbolizing the country's historical connection with Kyivan Rus.
original:
February 19, 2024 — State Coat of Arms Day On this day in 1992, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine approved the trident as the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine.

At the time when Ukraine was regaining its independence at the beginning of the last century, Mykhailo Hrushevsky commissioned graphic artist and architect Vasyl Krychevskyi to develop designs for the coat of arms and seal of the Ukrainian People's Republic.

He is, in fact, the one who introduced the Trident in its modern form.

The artist allegedly interpreted this sign as a stylized image of a falcon flying low for prey. Presumably, at the suggestion of Mykhailo Hrushevskyi, the graphic surrounded the Trident with a stylized olive wreath, which was supposed to reflect the peace policy of the Ukrainian People's Republic.

The creators of the modern Coat of Arms of Ukraine, the author's team consisting of historian Andrii Grechylo, artists Oleksiy Kokhan and Ivan Turetskyi, took Krychevsky's Trident as a basis.

What the Trident means is still not known for sure, none of its interpretations are final and convincing, but it is known for sure that it is often found on coins of the times of Prince Volodymyr the Great.

"The Kyiv state of Volodymyr the Great was the largest Ukrainian state that our history remembers. It covered all the then Ukrainian lands. From it originates our law, literacy, art, state and religious life... The Ukrainian People's Republic, having set the task of uniting Ukrainian lands in an independent Ukrainian state and restoring the fullness of cultural and political-national life, takes the old sign of Volodymyr the Great as its coat of arms." - this is how the First President of the Ukrainian People's Republic Mykhailo Hrushevsky argued his position, this is how Trident actually legitimizes the historical connection of the modern Ukrainian State with Kyivan Rus.

Today, Trident is undoubtedly one of the most recognizable symbols of Ukraine in the whole world. The information was prepared based on the materials of the portal about the culture of reading and the art of book publishing "Chitomo" 🇺🇦TG|FB|INST|Site

This morning, news began to spread on the Internet about the demolition of the monument to the satirist Zhvanetsky, who hated Russia with all his soul. Readovka checked this information and made sure that Zhvanetsky’s face still smiled arrogantly at Rostovites passing by him. The monument to the inveterate hater of everything Russian was erected last week. At its pompous opening, in addition to the regional governor Golubev, there were also ordinary Rostovites. The woman present reminded everyone present that Zhvanetsky was not only a consistent Russophobe, but also dreamed of literally leveling Russia. In 1993, the satirist stood and applauded the shooting of the White House, and during the Chechen wars he actively advocated early negotiations with terrorists.

However, the “peak” of Zhvanetsky’s Russophobic activities came after 2014, when the artist actively opposed the annexation of Crimea to Russia, for which Ukraine added him to the “white list.” And then the satirist even stated that “Russians very quickly get used to war,” because “they feed you in the trenches,” and “there is an opportunity to rob somewhere, to sleep with someone.” So the question of why Zhvanetsky is still standing in Rostov-on-Don and “laughing at the townspeople” remains open.

description: Over the past year, the number of deserters has increased by 914.3%, with 36% of applicants being deserters. Many contract soldiers, including those forcibly transferred from conscription, are deserting due to witnessing war horrors, being treated as expendable, and realizing the lies told on TV. They often have pre-existing illnesses and receive inadequate medical treatment.
original:
Over the past year, the number of deserters has increased 10 times!

And as a percentage, this is 914.3% (January 2023 - 28 deserters vs January 2024 - 284 deserters) Last month, of the total number of applicants, 36% were deserters. Who are they: 30% mobilized, 50% contract soldiers who signed a contract after the start of the war and 10 % contract soldiers who signed a contract before the start of the war and another 10% all the rest. Contract soldiers are not always volunteers who have been subjected to propaganda or recruitment, they are also conscripts forcibly transferred to a contract. Why do they write to us: they have seen enough horrors in the war, they have seen the attitude towards people, treated as expendable material and cannon fodder, realized that they were not fighting against “fascists”, that what they were told on TV was a lie. They often had non-conscription illnesses before serving, which did not bother anyone at all. They receive shrapnel wounds and injuries, which are literally treated with anesthesia and sent back to the front. Let's remember the story of how a guy without an eye was returned to the trenches.

They are writing to us now because they didn’t know about us, didn’t know who to turn to, didn’t know in general that they had the opportunity to write to someone who would get them out of the war.

Wives, relatives and friends of those who were mobilized also write to us - who, together with us, manage to help the deserters find themselves in a safe place.

Obviously, the increase in the number of deserters is also influenced by the fact that almost a year and a half has passed since the announcement of mobilization, there is no rotation in the troops, and many, without hoping for anything, choose to desert. Today we live in a world where the Russian army brings only death and destruction. Deserting from it is the easiest way to help your country. Together we are strong. Let's take action. See you on February 29. Join Deserter DayWrite for help in “Go through the forest”|Send news or agenda|Telegram |Instagram |Support one-time|Support monthly

description: In Russia, starting March, the popularization of VPN services will be banned, as it is considered a 'portal to hell.' Roskomnadzor will block services allowing access to prohibited resources, and refusal to delete information may result in a fine of up to 4 million rubles.
original:
CHTDVideo,🎪👹In Russia, starting in March, the popularization of VPN services will be banned, because it is a “portal to hell.”

Head of the League...🙈In RuNet they began to clear information about VPN services. For example, data about VPN, including instructions for setting up a network to access blocked sites, propalis from the technical forum 4PDA and from corporate media SkillFactory. The SecurityLab website also edited or removed materials about VPNs. Information about VPN is still available on the Cyberforum, VC and Habr sites.

The VPN technology itself has not yet been banned in the Russian Federation, but Roskomnadzor still blocks services for allowing Russians access to prohibited resources. From March 1 this year, a ban on the so-called popularization of VPNs and information about ways to bypass blocking comes into force in Russia. For refusal to delete information there is a risk of blocking with a fine of up to 4 million rubles.

description: A 33-year-old Ukrainian national was found dead with bullet holes near a garage in Villajoyos, Spain. The police were alerted by the victim's neighbor. The identity of the deceased remains unknown.
original:
Rosich | RosichPhoto, In Spain, Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian military helicopter, was allegedly found dead -... Apparently, the Ukrainian who died in Spain is not the pilot who hijacked the helicopter on the Ukrainian side, writes the publication “Caution, News”.

Spanish media, to which Russian publications referred, indicate a different age of the deceased and do not disclose his identity.

On February 14, several Spanish media, including ABC and Levante-EMV, reported the murder of a “33-year-old Ukrainian” in the city of Villajoyos. It was alleged that on February 13, police found a body with bullet holes near the garage. The man's neighbor called the security forces.

The age of the deceased (33 years) and Kuzminov’s age do not match; he is 28 years old.

The fact that it was Kuzminov who died was reported by the Eureka News project, citing “unofficial information” from the National Guard in its profile. The media claimed that Kuzminov “behaved inappropriately,” abused alcohol and talked a lot about his past and present. The account also suggested that Kuzminov could have been killed by Ukrainian special services.

This media does not have a website, only an account in X and a telegram channel. In it, information about Kuzminov’s personality was presented as “unofficial information” from representatives of the Spanish Civil Guard. Despite the 24 thousand subscribers of the Spanish EurekaNews account, the post about Kuzminov’s death was appreciated by only four people, the publication noted. Thus, most likely, the news about Kuzminov’s death is fake.@rosich_ru

original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant's office and the National Guard in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives experts neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

We see how Western terrorists, together with their Ukrainian accomplices, wanted to once again organize a monstrous terrorist attack and blame Russia for everything.

description: Security guards at a Spar grocery store in Moscow extorted 40,000 rubles from a 74-year-old pensioner, Maria Aponasovna, after she forgot to pay for a sausage. They intimidated her with a criminal case and took a photo of her Muscovite card to track her down if she didn't comply.
original:
The grocery store security guards, who demanded money from a pensioner for a forgotten sausage, took a photo of her Muscovite card in order to find the woman if she did not bring the money.

Maria Aponasovna told investigators that she put the sausage in a separate bag so that it would not get soggy from the melting cauliflower in the basket. And I completely forgot about it when I paid for my purchases. The sausage, according to her, cost no more than 400 rubles.

At the exit from Spar, four guards surrounded her and began to intimidate her with a criminal case. In order for everything to end without noise, the woman was demanded 40 thousand rubles - supposedly a hundredfold fine. The pensioner tried to transfer money through mobile banking, but it didn’t work out. Maria Aponasovna's hands and legs were shaking from the intimidation; on the way to Sber, she slipped and broke her knees. When the pensioner returned with cash, three guards disappeared somewhere - she was met by one man, scared and constantly looking around. He said to put the money on the edge of the table.

The pensioner didn’t want to tell anyone about what happened, but at home her daughter noticed that her mother was too distracted. Then Maria Aponasovna confessed everything. The daughter contacted the police. During a conversation with investigators, Maria accurately pointed to one of the security guards, who took a photo of her Muscovite card in order to find the woman if she did not come with the money.

Now Maria bypasses the store and asks her relatives to take the application back because she is afraid of revenge.TelegramBazaA pensioner from Moscow forgot to pay for sausage at the grocery store. The guards demanded 50 thousand rubles from her so as not to call the police.

74-year-old Maria ...VIEW MESSAGE

description: China showcased its latest kamikaze drone, the ASN-301 loitering munition, at the World Defense Expo in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. The drone is designed to destroy radar objects and can recognize radio sources within a 25 km range. It is equipped with a warhead containing 7,000 submunitions capable of eliminating targets within a 20-meter radius.
original:
At the World Defense Expo in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in February, China unveiled its latest kamikaze drone creation, the ASN-301 loitering munition.

Western observers believe that this product resembles the Harpy drone, developed by the Israeli company IAI. These UAVs were purchased by the PRC in the 1990s. Analogies are also drawn with the Iranian Shahed-136.

ASN-301, with a weight of 135 kg, is somewhat more compact and has a length of 2.5 meters. The maximum flight speed is 220 km/h, the range is 288 km, and the flight time is four hours.

The drone is designed to destroy objects with a radar signature, such as radar. It targets radio sources in the range from 2 to 16 GHz, being able to recognize them at a range of 25 km. The warhead of the UAV is equipped with 7 thousand submunitions that are capable of eliminating a target within a radius of 20 meters.

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces received 800 sets of anti-drone protection from a Danish company, worth 40 million euros. The Wingman series detector can detect drone control signals at various frequencies, with a detection range of up to 6 km and a detection time of less than 10 seconds.
original:
By the way. According to the Danish company, the cost of one set of anti-drone protection (a detector with an active antenna and a jammer) is about 50 thousand euros.

Considering that the Ukrainian Armed Forces received 800 sets, the order amounts to a round sum of 40 million euros.

According to MyDefense materials presented at the World Defense Show, the Wingman series detector can detect drone control signals at frequencies of 2.4, 5.2, 5.8 GHz in the basic version, and with the addition of an additional (active) antenna 433, 868, 915 MHz and 1.2 GHz.

Detection occurs in a sector of 60 degrees in the azimuthal plane and from 0 to 60 in the vertical plane at a distance of up to 6 km (subject to direct radio visibility).

Detection time less than 10 seconds.

Operating time on one battery is up to 14 hours.

He said Russian aggression, if left unchecked, not only potentially impedes security cooperation and harms U.S. defense contractors, but could also weaken Europe more broadly and disrupt the NATO bloc's trade relations with the world's largest economy. “One of Many aspects of our transatlantic cooperation is that we have already signed hundreds of contracts worth billions of dollars and are about to prepare new contracts. Clearly, an alliance for our common security brings many benefits—for both sides. Less security in Europe means less security for the United States. We must not take freedom for granted. You need to protect her when necessary. The UK is already doing more and more (for Ukraine) and France is increasing its support.
