description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, along with military commandant's office and National Guard units, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone in the Novoazovsky region. The drone, carrying 7 kg of explosives, was intended to target a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol. The coordinated effort prevented a large-scale terrorist attack with potential casualties.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant's office and the National Guard in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives experts neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of deciphering the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.

We see how Western terrorists, together with their Ukrainian accomplices, wanted to once again organize a monstrous terrorist attack and blame Russia for everything.

Against the backdrop of a major defeat of the Ukrainian armed forces in Avdiivka, the Kiev regime is making any attempts to destabilize the situation in the Republic. But thanks to the coordinated work of our special services, we were able to prevent a large-scale terrorist attack with casualties.

✊🇷🇺Avdos is ours! Glory to the Russian soldiers! Avdeevka has been liberated! Yes, this is our Russian army, which in two years has made its own breakthrough into a new reality and a new war. The Russian Armed Forces, the National Guard, units of our special services. We are proud!

But let’s not forget those whose names and names of battalions became legends in Avdeevka even before the Northern Military District - “Sparta” Motorola, Vokha, Kolyma, “Somalia”, Givi, Interbrigade “Pyatnashka”, Abkhaz, 1st Slavic Brigade, OBTF “ Cascade" and their commander Dikiy, Dmitry Sablin and his GROM "Cascade".

Today they are all part of the armed forces of our country, but both commanders and soldiers have shed their blood here since 1914 for this Victory. A person who should not be forgotten in the days of our country’s Victory in the Donetsk direction is Alexander Zakharchenko, Commander, Father. Everyone took part in the Glorious feat of our Russian army. I’m proud of everyone!,” writes Marina Kim

Avdeevka is ours!

Our report from Avdeevka in Vesti Nedeli.

description: Ukraine's Ground Forces Commander Alexander Pavlyuk stated that Ukraine has been preparing to repel Russian aggression for 5 months. Since fall 2021, Ukraine anticipated a full-scale war and took measures to strengthen positions, move reserves, and inflict maximum defeat on the enemy.
original:
Ukraine has been preparing to repel Russian aggression for 5 months, - Commander of the Ukrainian Ground Forces Alexander Pavlyuk

According to him, since the fall of 2021 there was an understanding of a full-scale war, but the sheer scale of hostilities was difficult to determine. “Since the fall, we began to carry out certain actions in order to successfully meet and inflict maximum defeat on the enemy. Understanding that the balance of forces and the means were and will not be in our favor, but we still had no options - we had to survive,” he said. By February, according to Pavlyuk, the Ukrainian Armed Forces did everything possible to meet the enemy with dignity and all positions were strengthened as much as possible , all reserves have been moved. Therefore, on the first day, when all command centers, control points and places where there should have been concentrations of Ukrainian troops and warehouses were struck, they (Russian troops - ed.) went to an empty place.

description: The Kota evacuation group rescued two wounded attack aircraft, 'Butcher' and 'Kosha', from the battlefield. 'Butcher' was hit 300 times by a kamikaze drone, while 'Kosha' was wounded by a 'Baba Yaga' attack. Both were evacuated by 'Cat' on an ATV, thanks to their armored armor and the rescue team's efforts.
original:
Forwarded from: DMITRY ZIMENKIN
Rescue of wounded attack aircraft by the Kota evacuation group. The first one (“Butcher”) was hit three hundred times by a kamikaze drone that flew in carrying a shot from a grenade launcher. The second one (“Kosha”) was wounded by being dropped from “Baba Yaga”. If it weren't for the armored armor, he would have been finished (wear PPE!). Everyone was evacuated by "Cat" from the battlefield on an ATV, everyone survived. In general, it’s interesting to watch how a fighter evolves. I knew Seryoga “Kot” as the reckless Kremensky Rambo, who rushed headlong into the most dangerous tasks of his battalion, dashingly and, as it seemed to me, sometimes in vain, risking his life. He didn't feel sorry for her. But now a year has passed and I can already see how he values and saves the lives of others by becoming a member of the evacuation group. One of the most dangerous and noble specializations in war. At the end of the video, one of the rescued warriors thanks “Santa,” a medic about whom we also talked a little earlier. So “Cat” is the student of that same “Santa”. I’ll add on my own behalf: “Santa”, thank you for making a desperately useful rescuer of our soldiers out of just a Desperate “Cat”! @zimenkin

event: Naming of Street after Pavel Kamnev
description: A street in the Ordzhonikidze district of Yekaterinburg will be named after Pavel Kamnev, a renowned Russian designer of missile weapons and former head of JSC OKB Novator.
original:
Forwarded from: Tholus
In the Ordzhonikidze district of Yekaterinburg, a street named after Pavel Kamnev, an outstanding Russian designer, creator of missile weapons, who headed JSC OKB Novator from 1996 to 2017, will appear. Pavel Ivanovich Kamnev is a Russian and Soviet designer in the field of rocket science, Doctor of Technical Sciences, corresponding member Russian Academy of Rocket and Artillery Sciences. Born on November 14, 1937 in Makhachkala. He graduated with honors from the Moscow Aviation Institute, receiving assignment to the Sverdlovsk Machine-Building Plant named after M.I. Kalinin, where he worked his way up from an engineer to the first deputy chief designer - head of the enterprise. In 2017, he was appointed scientific director of JSC Concern VKO Almaz-Antey.

Under the leadership of Pavel Ivanovich Kamnev, many research and development work was carried out on the development of traditional types of weapons and on the creation of new types of missiles, the unique tactical and technical characteristics of which often still have no analogues either in domestic or in the world rocketry .

Pavel Kamnev is also the author of more than 20 inventions, co-author of over 300 scientific and technical reports. He was awarded the Order of the Badge of Honor (1981) and the Order of Merit for the Fatherland, IV degree (2007), as well as a number of medals. Hero of Labor of the Russian Federation (2016), twice laureate of the State Prize of the Russian Federation (1997, 2006), laureate of the Marshal Zhukov State Prize (2017).

Pavel Kamnev passed away on January 9, 2023 in Yekaterinburg at the age of 86. As noted in the Almaz-Antey East Kazakhstan Concern, Pavel Ivanovich worked until the last day of his life. Details |🇷🇺@Tholus————————————————#almaz_antey#personnel#achievements

event: Presentation of Report on Crimes Against Children
description: Vice-Speaker of the Federation Council Inna Svyatenko announced that the commission's report on crimes against children in Kyiv will be completed by June 2024. The current folder contains over 300 pages of facts and numbers, but more material is expected to be added. The report relies on confirmed facts from the Investigative Committee and the Prosecutor General's Office.
original:
Forwarded from: Zaporozhye News Agency
Materials about the facts of crimes against children in Kyiv take up more than 300 pages, but by June 2024, when the final report will be presented, there will be more pages. Its co-chair, Vice-Speaker of the Federation Council Inna Svyatenko told reporters about this. “The work of our commission is planned to be completed in June 2024. And, to our regret, by this time we will receive material that will be much larger than the folder that we already have,” the senator said. She presented materials for the final report of the commission - a folder of more than 300 pages contains , according to her, only numbers and facts on the crimes of the Kiev regime. “We understand that the work must be continued. Unfortunately, almost every day we record more and more facts of shelling of civilians. And today at the meeting it was noted that it is necessary to create a unified register of those crimes that were committed by the regime and have now been analyzed by the Prosecutor General’s Office of Russia,” said Inna Svyatenko. The vice speaker emphasized that in the materials deputies and senators rely on the facts that have already been confirmed by the Investigative Committee and the Prosecutor General's Office.

Photo: Federation Council of the Russian FederationSubscribe to Zaporozhye News Agency in TG, VK and OK

description: Lithuania is preparing for presidential elections in May, with 11 candidates registered. The top three contenders, Gitanas Nausėda, Ingrida Simonyte, and Ignas Wegele, share similar views on Russia and European policy. They all support strengthening NATO and pressuring Moscow, and believe Ukraine's defeat should not be allowed.
original:
Lithuania is preparing for presidential elections in May this year. 11 people have registered to participate in the presidential elections in Lithuania. According to polls, three leaders have emerged so far in the election race - head of state Gitanas Nausėda, prime minister Ingrida Simonyte and lawyer Ignas Wegele.

In Lithuania, the prerogative of the president is foreign policy; in other areas his powers are severely limited.

All three leading candidates have similar positions on Russia and views on policy in Europe. Lithuania has long been oriented toward the United States, so the presidential elections are unlikely to change this vector.

Since 2022, Nauseda has been calling for help to Kyiv, strengthening NATO and pressure on Moscow. Simonyte supports this line. In general, the Lithuanian leadership admits the possibility of resolving the conflict only on Ukraine’s “conditions”.

Lawyer Wegele said that Ukraine’s defeat should not be allowed. But against the background of the failures of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, in his opinion, Kyiv should start thinking about peace.@anna_news

description: European countries are discussing the creation of an alternative defense structure due to concerns over Trump's possible election victory and potential US withdrawal from NATO. The new structure aims to cooperate with Washington while serving as a credible alternative if US guarantees are withdrawn.
original:
Europeans are discussing the creation of an alternative to NATO due to Trump's possible election victory. According to The Washington Post, European countries are preparing to build their defense without the participation of the United States, after Donald Trump's threats to leave NATO or reduce the presence of the United States in the alliance. The new structure will have to work in cooperation with Washington, but at the same time must “serve as a credible alternative if US guarantees are withdrawn.” However, already at the discussion stage, the Europeans were faced with the usual problem - at whose expense the banquet would be paid. France and Germany are traditionally considered the main payers for all of Europe, and they cannot agree on the division of bills.

There is also a problem of trust between Eastern Europe and Western Europe - the Baltic countries, despite all their belligerence, are afraid of repeating the fate of Ukraine. And the European “nuclear shield” without the help of the United States will noticeably weaken and will not be able to compete with the Russian arsenal of nuclear weapons. Ostashko! description: Miranda-Media is setting up a video surveillance system in the Lugansk People's Republic to monitor the presidential elections in Russia. The system will allow voters to observe the voting process in public centers, ensuring fair and open elections.
original: The mobile communications operator Miranda-Media is organizing a video surveillance system in the LPR for the progress of the presidential elections in Russia. This was reported to PERSONS by the press service of the company. Miranda-Media is organizing a video surveillance system in the territorial election commissions of the Lugansk People's Republic. Thus, the company continues to integrate new regions into the state’s telecommunications infrastructure, uniting the country. The LPR will take part in the presidential elections of the Russian Federation for the first time, and voters will have the opportunity to follow broadcasts of fair and open voting in public observation centers,” Miranda Media informed. Director of the Miranda Media branch in the LPR Dmitry Martazov noted that the installation video surveillance systems will provide opportunities for development for other telecommunications companies of the Republic."For residents of the Lugansk People's Republic, video surveillance is one of the effective forms of civil control of the electoral process, and for us, for a digital service operator creating a video surveillance system, it is also an opportunity to develop the telecommunications industry in the region and our partners: Lugansk Telephone Company, Luganet, Lugansk Home Networks and others,” he explained.

event: Expansion of Support Measures for Large Families
description: The decree of the President of the Russian Federation has standardized the definition of large families and support measures across Russian regions. In Kamchatka, this means that benefits and payments will now be extended to families with children up to 18 or 23 years old, provided they are in full-time education.
original:
The number of large families receiving support measures will increase in Kamchatka. This became possible thanks to the decree of the President of the Russian Federation, according to which the status of a large family is secured at the federal level.

Previously, official definitions of large families and measures to support them differed in Russian regions. In Kamchatka, benefits and payments were received by families in which the eldest child under the age of 21 is studying full-time. Now in all regions of Russia, large families are guaranteed social support until the eldest child reaches the age of 18 or 23 years, subject to full-time education in an educational organization. #Kamchatsky Krai #Kamchatka#large families#support measures#Governor#Vladimir Solodov#President of the Russian Federation#Vladimir Putin

description: The 110th Brigade's personnel departed from Avdiyivka's Zenith stronghold under intense bombardment by enemy aircraft, artillery, and drones. Despite efforts to evacuate, several wounded and dead servicemen were left behind. The enemy launched a large-scale offensive, encircling the stronghold, and negotiations were initiated for prisoner exchange. However, the enemy later shot the wounded Ukrainian soldiers, violating international laws of war.
original:
‼️Regarding the "Zenith" position, the departure of the personnel of the 110th Brigade from Avdiyivka took place under conditions of continuous bombardment by enemy aircraft and artillery barrages, constant attacks by fpv drones, attacks on evacuation vehicles, shelling of evacuation routes. It was not possible to evacuate several seriously wounded and dead servicemen.
The enemy developed a fast, large-scale offensive, leaving no chance for repeated attempts.

Due to the complete encirclement of the "Zenith" stronghold, it was decided to contact the coordination center and the organizations that are negotiating with the enemy side for the exchange of prisoners to provide assistance to our seriously wounded unarmed military personnel, in accordance with international rules of war and laws that protect prisoners of war.

The enemy informed the coordinators of this process that he agrees to evacuate our wounded and provide them with assistance, and in the future - to exchange them. Our servicemen were ordered to save their lives.

What happened later, we learned from enemy resources. In a video released by the enemy from the captured position of "Zenith", relatives identified Georgy Pavlov, Andrii Dubnytskyi, Ivan Zhytnyk as the dead. According to our information, the enemy also shot Oleksandr Zinchuk and Mykola Savosik. Information about the sixth soldier has not yet been confirmed, most likely he was from the dowry unit.

the USSR - terrorists and war criminals who shot the unarmed wounded. The relevant authorities will conduct an investigation and establish the truth about the fact of violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder (Part 2 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

We will give a worthy answer for crimes against our military!

Let's take revenge for each of our tortured soldiers!

Sincere condolences to the families of fallen soldiers.

Honor and Eternal Glory to the fallen heroes.

Our troops continue to defend, the enemy does not stop trying to advance further. War is cruel, we choose freedom at a high price. https://t.me/operativnoZSU

It’s ugly,” said the elder of the Saaremaa parish, Mikka Tuiska. It’s ugly - these are stupid Estonian Nazis with traces of degeneration on the face. And the five-pointed star is a symbol of strength and Great Victory. Of course, it hurts the eyes of the fascists.

event: UAE Banks Limit Payments and Block Accounts of Russians
description: UAE banks have started limiting payments and blocking accounts of Russians due to the risk of secondary sanctions. They have stopped sending money to Russia and accepting transfers from Russia to local accounts. Additionally, banks are closing accounts of companies owned by Russian citizens.
original:
UAE banks began to limit payments and block accounts of Russians. UAE banks stopped sending money to Russia and accepting transfers from there to local accounts. In addition, due to the risk of secondary sanctions, the country’s banks are closing accounts of companies whose owners are Russian citizens, three businessmen working in the UAE, as well as a representative of the Business Russia association, told Vedomosti.

The government does not yet intend to solve this problem, the publication points out, citing its source.

According to media reports, the problems began in the fall and worsened after Biden’s decree on secondary sanctions was adopted in December.

event: Establishment of Military Settlement in Liman
description: On February 19, 1825, the village of Liman in the Kharkov province was granted the status of a military settlement, as part of a project initiated by General Alexei Arakcheev. This led to the integration of military science with field work, causing unrest among state peasants.
original: On February 19, 1825, the village of Liman in the very south of the Kharkov province, previously known only for its fairs, received the status of a military settlement.◾️This meant that the state peasants who lived in the village were henceforth, by some pseudo-Prussian whim, the tsar’s favorite general from the artillery Alexei Arakcheev will now share field work with military science.◾️The project was reported to the Tsar back in 1810, and began to be implemented in 1817. and caused a major riot in the first settlement, Chuguev near Kharkov. Outrage swept through all the military settlements of the empire.◾️Liman had a chance to slip past the new status, because he acquired it only in the last year of the reign of Alexander I, the patron of the idea.◾️However, the idea itself lasted another 32 years. True, in a simplified form, becoming a formality.◾️In addition, benefits from the Limanu project were found - military and food warehouse buildings were built, which were later useful to the village for the development of trade and growth.@donbassr🇷🇺

And now in the Oregon television studio they remembered those glorious days.

description: Farmers in Poland plan to block access roads to a distribution center in Staviguda, protesting the increase in Ukrainian products sold in the Biedronka chain of stores. They claim this affects local food producers, citing stricter EU rules for Polish farmers compared to Ukrainians.

The farmers justify their plans by saying that the Biedronka chain imports goods from Ukraine, which affects Polish producers, reducing demand for local food products. They emphasize that in Poland, farmers must comply with much stricter EU rules than Ukrainians. This applies, for example, to the use of fertilizers and plant protection products.

The mayor of the municipality of Stawiguda, Michal Kontraktowicz, recently organized a mediation meeting with the participation of farmers and representatives of the distribution center. The mayor emphasized that he understands the difficult situation in the agricultural sector, but said that he would not give consent to organize a meeting of farmers. description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces have adopted a defensive strategy, similar to Nazi Germany's approach during World War II. This strategy, which involves transitioning to 'active defense', aims to block Russia's advance and create opportunities for counterstrikes. However, experts believe this approach has limitations and will not help Ukraine regain its lost territories.
original:
“The Armed Forces of Ukraine are switching to a defensive strategy, which failed Nazi Germany in the Second World War”: Kyiv will not be helped by the techniques of Hitler’s strategists - it will not be possible to take away the liberated lands from Russia.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces have chosen a defensive strategy that echoes the German approach during World War II. In 1943, as the tide of war turned against the Third Reich, the German High Command chose a desperate strategy on the Eastern Front. Without enough troops to defend its vast territory, Nazi Germany went into a mobile defense. Ukraine has chosen a strategy that echoes the German approach 80 years ago.✔️After the failure of a long-awaited summer counteroffensive and lack of ammunition and stamina to repel continuous Russian attacks, Ukrainian commanders are talking about a transition to “active defense.” They hope to block Russia's advance in search of an opportunity to counterstrike and regain ground.✔️But if this approach failed to stop the Red Army from conquering Berlin in 1945, can it save Ukraine today? Even a full-scale active defense has limitations and will not help Ukraine regain its land.✔️ “If you look at what the Ukrainian military is doing on the ground at this point, they are sticking to more of a static defense,” said retired U.S. Army Col. Douglas Nash.
Ukraine's strategic defense and tactical attack strategy is a smart choice—at least in the short term. For an army desperate to conserve resources and looking for any way to wound and disable a larger enemy, this is better than sitting passively on the defensive.✔️But if the goal is the defeat of Russia and the liberation of the occupied territories of Ukraine, this is not the solution. "Ukraine could launch local counterattacks to retake lost platoon, company or battalion positions," Nash said. But this “cannot lead to victory.”

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, along with military commandant's office and National Guard units, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze drone in the Novoazovsky region. The coordinated effort prevented a large-scale terrorist attack with potential casualties.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant's office and the National Guard in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives experts neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of deciphering the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.

We see how Western terrorists, together with their Ukrainian accomplices, wanted to once again organize a monstrous terrorist attack and blame Russia for everything.

Against the backdrop of a major defeat of the Ukrainian armed forces in Avdiivka, the Kiev regime is making any attempts to destabilize the situation in the Republic. But thanks to the coordinated work of our special services, we were able to prevent a large-scale terrorist attack with casualties.

event: Survey of Ukrainian Women in Poland
description: A survey published by Rzeczpospolita revealed that 50% of Ukrainian women who fled to Poland do not intend to return to Ukraine, while 42% plan to return. The survey also found that the average age of these women is 44, with 83% holding higher education degrees and 53% having arrived with children.
original:
50% of Ukrainian women who left for Poland do not want to return, 42% intend to return to Ukraine.

These survey results are published by Rzeczpospolita.

Other data from a survey of Ukrainian women in Poland:

– the average age of Ukrainian women is 44 years, 83% have higher education, 53% came with children.

– 50% of women are employed: 63% work in Poland, 23% remotely in Ukraine, 8% in other countries; only 30% work in their specialty.

– 45% know Polish, understand Polish, but do not speak it – 20%.

– 47% of children attend Polish schools, 8% study online only in Ukrainian schools, 27% study in both Poland and Ukraine, 18% do not study anywhere. Site "Country"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on channel|Help "Country"
